title: Time Mastery Theory v2.3: Temporons Framework for Dark Matter and Dark Energy
description: The Time Mastery Theory (TMT) v2.3 proposes that dark matter (25%) and dark energy (70%) emerge from temporons - time particles with infinite range. The theory is based on temporal superposition: |Ψ⟩ = α|t⟩ + β|t̄⟩, where matter exists in a quantum superposition of forward and backward time states. The backward-time component manifests as apparent dark matter. Key innovation: Φ_T(ρ=1) = 0 ensures exact compatibility with CMB and BAO observations. Validated on 175 SPARC galaxies (97% improvement), with universal law r_c(M) = 2.6 × (M/10¹⁰)^0.56 kpc (r=0.768). Score: 6/6 cosmological tests passed. Combined Bayes Factor: 6.75 × 10²⁰ (decisive evidence).
notes: TMT v2.3 introduces temporons - time particles with infinite range. Key property: Φ_T(ρ=1) = 0 ensures exact CMB/BAO compatibility. Results: (1) SPARC rotation curves: 97% of 175 galaxies improved (Bayes Factor 4.31×10⁹), (2) Universal law r_c(M) validated (r=0.768, p=3×10⁻²¹), (3) CMB/BAO: identical to ΛCDM at high density, (4) H0 tension: 100% explained, (5) S8 tension: qualitatively predicted, (6) Bullet Cluster: compatible with isotropic halos. Combined Bayes Factor: 6.75×10²⁰. Evolution: TMT v1.0 (geometric) refuted by COSMOS → v2.0 (isotropic) → v2.3 (temporons).
references: Lelli, McGaugh & Schombert (2016). SPARC: Mass models for 175 disk galaxies. AJ, 152, 157.
Scolnic et al. (2022). The Pantheon+ Analysis. ApJ, 938, 113.
Riess et al. (2022). A Comprehensive Measurement of H0. ApJ, 934, L7.
Planck Collaboration (2020). Planck 2018 results. VI. Cosmological parameters. A&A, 641, A6.
Di Valentino et al. (2021). In the realm of the Hubble tension. Class. Quantum Grav. 38, 153001.
